connector.description: Upload, download and manage files, folders, groups, collaborations, etc. on box.com.

camel.sink.path.apiName.name: camel.sink.path.apiName
camel.sink.path.apiName.description: What kind of operation to perform One of: [COLLABORATIONS] [COMMENTS] [EVENT_LOGS] [FILES] [FOLDERS] [GROUPS] [EVENTS] [SEARCH] [TASKS] [USERS]

camel.sink.path.methodName.name: camel.sink.path.methodName
camel.sink.path.methodName.description: What sub operation to use for the selected operation

camel.sink.endpoint.enterpriseId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.enterpriseId
camel.sink.endpoint.enterpriseId.description: The enterprise ID to use for an App Enterprise.

camel.sink.endpoint.inBody.name: camel.sink.endpoint.inBody
camel.sink.endpoint.inBody.description: Sets the name of a parameter to be passed in the exchange In Body

camel.sink.endpoint.userId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.userId
camel.sink.endpoint.userId.description: The user ID to use for an App User.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpParams.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpParams
camel.sink.endpoint.httpParams.description: Custom HTTP params for settings like proxy host

camel.sink.endpoint.authenticationType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.authenticationType
camel.sink.endpoint.authenticationType.description: The type of authentication for connection. Types of Authentication: STANDARD_AUTHENTICATION - OAuth 2.0 (3-legged) SERVER_AUTHENTICATION - OAuth 2.0 with JSON Web Tokens

camel.sink.endpoint.accessTokenCache.name: camel.sink.endpoint.accessTokenCache
camel.sink.endpoint.accessTokenCache.description: Custom Access Token Cache for storing and retrieving access tokens.

camel.sink.endpoint.encryptionAlgorithm.name: camel.sink.endpoint.encryptionAlgorithm
camel.sink.endpoint.encryptionAlgorithm.description: The type of encryption algorithm for JWT. Supported Algorithms: RSA_SHA_256 RSA_SHA_384 RSA_SHA_512 One of: [RSA_SHA_256] [RSA_SHA_384] [RSA_SHA_512]

camel.sink.endpoint.maxCacheEntries.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxCacheEntries
camel.sink.endpoint.maxCacheEntries.description: The maximum number of access tokens in cache.

camel.sink.endpoint.privateKeyFile.name: camel.sink.endpoint.privateKeyFile
camel.sink.endpoint.privateKeyFile.description: The private key for generating the JWT signature.

camel.sink.endpoint.privateKeyPassword.name: camel.sink.endpoint.privateKeyPassword
camel.sink.endpoint.privateKeyPassword.description: The password for the private key.

camel.sink.endpoint.publicKeyId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.publicKeyId
camel.sink.endpoint.publicKeyId.description: The ID for public key for validating the JWT signature.

camel.sink.endpoint.userName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.userName
camel.sink.endpoint.userName.description: Box user name, MUST be provided

camel.sink.endpoint.userPassword.name: camel.sink.endpoint.userPassword
camel.sink.endpoint.userPassword.description: Box user password, MUST be provided if authSecureStorage is not set, or returns null on first call

camel.component.box.enterpriseId.name: camel.component.box.enterpriseId
camel.component.box.enterpriseId.description: The enterprise ID to use for an App Enterprise.

camel.component.box.userId.name: camel.component.box.userId
camel.component.box.userId.description: The user ID to use for an App User.

camel.component.box.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.box.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.box.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.box.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.box.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.box.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.box.httpParams.name: camel.component.box.httpParams
camel.component.box.httpParams.description: Custom HTTP params for settings like proxy host

camel.component.box.maxCacheEntries.name: camel.component.box.maxCacheEntries
camel.component.box.maxCacheEntries.description: The maximum number of access tokens in cache.

camel.component.box.privateKeyPassword.name: camel.component.box.privateKeyPassword
camel.component.box.privateKeyPassword.description: The password for the private key.

camel.component.box.publicKeyId.name: camel.component.box.publicKeyId
camel.component.box.publicKeyId.description: The ID for public key for validating the JWT signature.

camel.component.box.userName.name: camel.component.box.userName
camel.component.box.userName.description: Box user name, MUST be provided

camel.component.box.userPassword.description: Box user password, MUST be provided if authSecureStorage is not set, or returns null on first call
